Text: approval of FERC article for eBizfor talking to me about this article for this Fridays eBiz Please read it over and let me have comments tomorrow morning Thursday it goes live pm Thursday evening Sorry for AOL my Notes is wreaking havoc today Jeff Steve confirmed that the report said power sellers did not exercise market power or price gouging so I put it in the article Take care Jeannie FERC Reportdoc

Fwd approval of FERC article for eBizasked me to forward this to you Did I get anything right Jeannie ReturnPath Received from rlyygmxaolcom rlyygmailaolcom by airygmailaolcom vr with ESMTP Wed Nov Received from postmasterenroncom outboundenroncom by rlyygmxaolcom vr with ESMTP Wed Nov Received from nahoumsmswpxcorpenroncom by postmasterenroncom postmaster with ESMTP id SAA for Wed Nov CDT From Received from enemtaenroncom unverified by nahoumsmswpxcorpenroncom Content Technologies SMTPRS with ESMTP id for Wed Nov Subject Re approval of FERC article for eBiz To XMailer Lotus Notes Release March MessageID Date Wed Nov XMIMETrack Serialize by Router on ENEMTAEnronRelease Intl March at PM MIMEVersion Contenttype multipartmixed BoundaryAFfeadfcAF ContentDisposition inline I think it looks good a few suggestions though I havent read the whole reprt so I cant say for sure that it alleges no price gouging make sure to forward this to Jeff my email is slow on the road We can say though that instead of blaming generators and marketers the report blames the structure of the market for Californias woes I think we should shorten the quote to something like the reprt is consistent with what we have said all along We should say that the scheduling penalties part of the order will penalize utilities for underscheduling not predicting Hedging is not about holding pirces down so much as it is about protecting people from wild price swings thats what allowing utilities to buy outside the spot should help do Also my title is just EVP and Chief of Staff o lcom To cc Subject approval of FERC article for eBiz PM Thanks for talking to me about this article for this Fridays eBiz Please read it over and let me have comments tomorrow morning Thursday it goes live pm Thursday evening Sorry for AOL my Notes is wreaking havoc today Jeff Steve confirmed that the report said power sellers did not exercise market power or price gouging so I put it in the article Take care Jeannie See attached file FERC Reportdoc FERC Reportdoc

revised Electricity opedIve incorporated your suggestions Still need to know current state mw capacity and no of peaking mw approved for next summer Hope Jeff can help or direct me to someone who can Sorry for this AOL transmission the system is running really slow Take care Jeannie Electricity Op Eddoc
